result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheri L. Douglas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Theft [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order denying defendant's request regarding costs and repayment.

ADDRESS INFO for Sheri L. Douglas
Current: 751 County Road K, Taycheedah Correctional Institution, Fond du Lac, WI 54936-1947 United States  (Effective: 04-22-2022)
Prior: 13817 7th St, Osseo, WI 54758

Case called at 9:46 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Sheri L. Douglas appeared by video, in custody from Taycheedah Correctional. Attorney Bryant S. Plank appeared via video. 
Attorney Trenton Piltz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Misdemeanor Theft; Repeater. Repeater acknowledged.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant is sentenced to 3 Months of Jail (Concurrent to 20CF1), Court Costs/surcharges, DNA sample/surcharges.
Defendant is not granted any sentence credit.

9:41 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Sheri L. Douglas not in court, Attorney Bryant S Plank for Sheri L. Douglas appeared by video. 
Defendant does not appear from Taycheedah Correctional.
Hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachment)

(9:35 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  
Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sheri L. Douglas appeared by video, in custody in Taycheedah Correctional Institution. Attorney Bryant S Plank for Sheri L. Douglas appeared by video. 
Attorney Plank advises was recently appointed and hasn't been able to communicate with defendant yet.
Attorney Plank advises has received an offer from the State which will probably be acceptable and requests new date.
Hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:02 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Sheri L. Douglas appeared in custody and via video from Taycheedah Correctional. Attorney Sonia Anderson appeared via video from the jail.
Hearing scheduled to address Preliminary Hearing Time Limits that were not addressed at the Initial Appearance.
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Attorney Anderson to inform the Public Defenders Office that the Defendant is requesting representation.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on  2/14/22.
RTN: 3/9/22 at 9:30 AM.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on February 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 11:01 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Sheri L. Douglas appeared in custody by video from Taycheedah Correctional, Attorney Afton Lewis appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant indicates that she did not receive a copy of the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant is advised of charges. Defendant is released on her own recognizance/no bond set.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 2/14/22 at 1:45 PM.
Court approves Zoom appearances as the Defendant will be at Taycheedah until November 2023.
Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
